definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

sentences.english: And now click on the two branches to give the snowman arms.
sentences.chinese: 接着现在按一下这两个树杈给雪人臂膀。

sentences.english: I like winter best because we can make snowmen and go skiing.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢冬天，因为我们能做雪人和去滑雪。

sentences.english: Everest Snowman foundling, blocked septic tanks.
sentences.chinese: 圣母峰雪人的弃婴，化粪池堵塞的凶手。

sentences.english: Dad, let's go make a snowman.
If it snows tomorrow, we will build a snowman.
sentences.chinese: 明天如果下雪，我们就堆雪人。

sentences.english: There are many other stories about the yeti.
sentences.chinese: 关于雪人还有许多其他的故事。

sentences.english: This image of the snowman soon became lucrative.
sentences.chinese: 雪人的这种形象很快就变得炙手可热了。

sentences.english: With a leap and a howl, he came down on his back and held on tight.
sentences.chinese: 随着一声嗥叫，他跳到了雪人的背上，紧紧抓住了它。

sentences.english: I'm a little snowman round and fat.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个圆圆胖胖的小雪人。

sentences.english: Little cookie pound the snowman with snowballs.
sentences.chinese: 小饼干抓起雪球去砸小雪人。

sentences.english: Click ALFY to help him make a snowman.
sentences.chinese: 按一下阿飞帮助他堆一个雪人。

sentences.english: Lhakpa told the policeman where she saw the yeti.
sentences.chinese: 拉卡帕告诉了警察她遭遇雪人的地方。

sentences.english: I like snowy weather because I can make a snowman .
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢下雪天，因为我可以堆雪人。

sentences.english: Then they start to make a snowman.

definition: snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
Père David's deer (Elaphurus davidianus), species of deer native to China that is critically endangered
